algorithm_technique: Calculate counts of even/odd numbers. If balanced or off by one, calculate swaps for both target parities and take the minimum.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum swaps to make adjacent elements have different parity.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy approach to count swaps needed to achieve alternating parity by placing odd/even numbers at target indices.
key_insights: The problem is solvable only if the counts of even and odd numbers are equal or differ by at most one.
The minimum swaps can be found by considering two target arrangements: starting with an even number or starting with an odd number.
The number of swaps to move an element to its target position is the absolute difference in their indices.
